channel.title: Static Array Issue
channel.description:
Ok. When doing the below, I get these errors:
.\Java\Main.java:52: not a statement Test.info[] = base[]; ^ .\Java\Main.java:52: ';' expected Test.info[] = base[]; ^ .\Java\Main.java:52: not a statement Test.info[] = base[]; ^ 3 errors
What I did, was this: In a file named Test.java, I put: [code] public static String info[]; [/code] Then in a file named Main.java, I put: [code] String base[] = {"12039809", "LV.lpack", "IT_WORKS_1", "IT_WORKS_2", "IT_WORKS_3"}; Test.info[] = base[]; [/code] It seems as if it should work, but it doesn't. It's probably a 'stupid' or silly mistake done by me, but I can't figure it out. Thanks in advance.

item.title: Static Array Issue
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Ok. When doing the below, I get these errors:

.\Java\Main.java:52: not a statement Test.info[] = base[]; ^ .\Java\Main.java:52: ';' expected Test.info[] = base[]; ^ .\Java\Main.java:52: not a statement Test.info[] = base[]; ^ 3 errors

What I did, was this:

In a file named Test.java, I put:

            public static String info[];

Then in a file named Main.java, I put:

	    String base[]  = {"12039809", "LV.lpack", "IT_WORKS_1", "IT_WORKS_2", "IT_WORKS_3"};
	    Test.info[] = base[];

It seems as if it should work, but it doesn’t. It’s probably a ‘stupid’ or silly mistake done by me, but I can’t figure it out.

Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
